hypothesis_content.title: Stress Regime Exhaustion via Perp Funding Rate Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: During a STRESS regime, if aggregate crypto perp funding rates remain neutral or slightly positive for 48 hours while prices continue to decline or chop, it indicates exhaustion of leveraged selling. A subsequent 4-hour candle close >2% above the 48-hour VWAP triggers a high-probability reversal to NEUTRAL or BULL, favoring long BTC/ETH.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Stress regimes are driven by forced liquidations and negative funding. Neutral funding amid fear suggests most leverage is flushed out. A strong close above VWAP indicates responsive buying absorbing remaining sell orders, often marking a local bottom and regime shift.
entry_conditions: Regime == STRESS for at least 5 days
Volume-weighted avg funding rate across top 10 crypto perps is between -0.001% and +0.005% for 48 hours
BTC 48-hour return is <= -3% or absolute price change <2% (sideways/grind)
Trigger: BTC 4-hour candle closes >2% above the 48-hour VWAP

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to NEUTRAL (model output) OR 8% price gain from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC breaks below the 48-hour low post-entry
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 days if no regime transition occurs

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of signals see price drop >5% within 48 hours of trigger, or the regime remains STRESS for >7 days post-signal in >50% of cases.
